description:
Observations to London Borough of Camden in connection with proposed redevelopment behind retained facades at 372 to 380 Gray's Inn Road and 285 to 297 Pentonville Road and demolition of buildings at 283 Pentonville Road and 368-370 Gray's Inn Road and construction of new replacement buildings to provide new office (Class B1) accommodation at first, second and third floor levels and dual use of ground floor for either retail (Class A1) or food and drink (Class A3). 

 Applicants Plan Nos:  3526/T20 POOB, 3526/T/(2)P02 B, P01B, S02B,P04B,P03B, P-1B, S01B, E01B
decision_conditions:
REASON: The Council are very disappointed at the lack of positive improvement on this scheme. The facadism with open plan behind would greatly change the appearance of the building. 

 Given the very unusual structural qualities of the existing building, straddling the railway below, the Council queried the practicality of the proposals, as well as the erosion of the special character of the building. 

 The Council disliked the roof alterations, particularly the loss of promient chimney stacks and the loss of the existing detailing at roof level. 

 The Council conclude that a cellular use would be far preferable to open plan offices.
